children.subject:
We are using Gradescope for homeworks and also for the exams.

We are also using Proctortrack for the exams.   Gradescope is not 

a big deal, you just upload your document (hw or exam) there, as

opposed to TSquare, and this helps us with the grading.  The

exams will look like the homeworks.  Look at the DP homework

and you'll see the format I'll use on the exam for the DP problems.

It is not a big deal.  We'll talk more about the exam (format, length etc.)

closer to the exam.

The exams will go out on Fridays and there will be a couple days window.

This is my first time doing an OMS class so I don't have all of the fine details

at this point.  If that bothers you, then you probably shouldn't register for

this course in its first offering, you should wait for a future semester.

--Eric

Can you reload the page and try again?  OK now?

I changed the links a few minutes ago.  --Eric
I am unable to access homeword still. When I click "Homework 1", I only see a dialog box to submit a pdf or image. But I dont see the question as such.
The homework is posted on word press: https://8803ga.wordpress.com/hw1/
I cannot access the homework pdf files.

According to Gradescope:

Gradescope is FERPA compliant: students must log in to see their work.
Thanks for confirming!  My concerns are allayed.

Hi.  I received an email saying I've been signed up for Gradescope.  Should we be using our gatech email for that?

Last semester the teaching staff for Artificial Intelligence strenuously insisted we should use throwaway emails to create Gradescope accounts, out of concerns about FERPA regulations:

Since we have to comply with FERPA regulations, we encourage you not to use your real name and e-mail address in Gradescope.  Instead, you will use a pseudonym and e-mail address of your choice and submit your T-Square / Gradescope mapping to us through this Google Form [link removed].

On the other hand, this UMich page seems to say Gradescope is OK:  https://www.safecomputing.umich.edu/dataguide/?q=node/62

So, which is it?

Professor,

Please pin this post as well.

Thank you!

Zhen,

Between here (Piazza), the course website (https://8803ga.wordpress.com/), and Gradescope you should have all the resources you need for this course.

-Michael

Hello everyone,

I just registered this course since the waitlist just got removed and the open registration window started. However, this course has not shown up in my t-square. But if everything is on gradescope, I don't really need t-square for this course, right?

Thanks for any advice.

history.content:
Welcome to Introduction to Graduate Algorithms.  
This class is an algorithmic-focused version of 6505.

The class webpage is here:   https://8803ga.wordpress.com
There you can find the class schedule, and the homeworks
will be posted there as well.  HW 1 is up there now, see:
    https://8803ga.wordpress.com/hws/
We will use Gradescope for hw and exam submissions. 
You'll receive a link soon to register on Gradescope.  

Please use Piazza to communicate with the TA's and I.

The first set of lectures are on dynamic programming (DP).
I've done my best to show you how I approach DP problems,
but it's the sort of thing you can only learn by doing lots of
practice problems.  So try some practice DP problems, and
post a question on Piazza if you get stuck or you want to 
check your solution (try not to give a spoiler for others).

The homeworks are worth relatively little so that you don't have
to stress if you can't solve some or finish it on-time, etc., and also
to minimize any incentive to cheat.  They are a great practice for 
the exams, so the value of your hw effort will show up, hopefully, on
your exam score.

We are excited to be working with you this semester.
This is our first time running an OMS course, so bear with us
as we'll surely have some bumps along the way as we 
figure things out.

--Eric
history.subject: Welcome and DP lectures
